text: Hi <@UFBNA9K9A>,  we are trying to pull data about sales quotes from HubSpot with our connector but we noticed that there's a problem preventing this. The problem is that the CRM API currently only supports retrieving quotes that have been created by a HubSpot user in a HubSpot account via an API key. And that is not viable option for us. We would need the support for OAuth authorization. Do you know when support for OAuth authorization would be available or if there's any workaround that we could try in the meantime?
We are also very curious to hear more about the timeline for creating and updating quotes through the CRM API. Especially when CRM API will support quotes via OAuth authorization.
I imagine it’s down to scalability, offsets can be pretty expensive queries with big databases :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi,
when integrating HubSpot with another CRM, it would be really beneficial to show the timeline so that Sales can see what the lead has done in terms of page visits, form submissions and so on.
Is this possible to get it into CRM with an integration somehow, manageable? Perhaps with a solution such as iframe? Mapping field to field with timeline activities doesn't seem like the right way to go?
(The CRM is MS Dynamics 365)
Thanks!

You can, I’ve not tried it in MS Dynamics but so long as you can pass the contact ID from Dynamics in a query string, you could try this: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/contact-timeline-embed|https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/contact-timeline-embed>

The only issue is that the Dynamics user needs to authenticate in browser with a HS account but as they would only need a CRM Free account, shouldn’t be too much of an issue?

If you’re on a HS Enterprise plan this might work for you? <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/analytics/analytics-overview|https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/analytics/analytics-overview>
